maml:description.maml:para: Log in to the Power BI service.

Log in to Power BI service with either a user or service principal account (application key or certificate). For user accounts, an Azure Active Directory (AAD) First-Party application is leveraged for authentication. To log out call Disconnect-PowerBIServiceAccount.

maml:Description.maml:para: Azure Active Directory (AAD) application ID (also known as Client ID) to be used with a certificate thumbprint (-CertificateThumbprint) to authenticate with a service principal account (-ServicePrincipal).

Certificate thumbprint of an installed certificate associated to an Azure Active Directory (AAD) application. Certificate must be installed in either the CurrentUser or LocalMachine personal certificate stores (LocalMachine requires an administrator prompt to access) with a private key installed.
The custom environment to use for the environments returned from the discovery url.
The discovery url to get the backend services info from. Custom environment must also be supplied.
Cloud environment to connect against. Default is Public.
Indicates to use a service principal account, as opposed to a user account.
Tenant name or tenant ID containing the service principal account. If not specified, the 'COMMON' tenant is used.
PSCredential representing the Azure Active Directory (AAD) application client ID (username) and application secret key (password) to authenticate with a service principal account (-ServicePrincipal).
The custom environment to use for the environments returned from the discovery url.
The discovery url to get the backend services info from. Custom environment must also be supplied.
Cloud environment to connect against. Default is Public.
Indicates to use a service principal account, as opposed to a user account.
Tenant name or tenant ID containing the service principal account. If not specified, the 'COMMON' tenant is used.
PSCredential representing the Azure Active Directory (AAD) application client ID (username) and application secret key (password) to authenticate with a service principal account (-ServicePrincipal).
The custom environment to use for the environments returned from the discovery url.
The discovery url to get the backend services info from. Custom environment must also be supplied.
Cloud environment to connect against. Default is Public.

Azure Active Directory (AAD) application ID (also known as Client ID) to be used with a certificate thumbprint (-CertificateThumbprint) to authenticate with a service principal account (-ServicePrincipal).

Certificate thumbprint of an installed certificate associated to an Azure Active Directory (AAD) application. Certificate must be installed in either the CurrentUser or LocalMachine personal certificate stores (LocalMachine requires an administrator prompt to access) with a private key installed.
PSCredential representing the Azure Active Directory (AAD) application client ID (username) and application secret key (password) to authenticate with a service principal account (-ServicePrincipal).
The custom environment to use for the environments returned from the discovery url.
The discovery url to get the backend services info from. Custom environment must also be supplied.
Cloud environment to connect against. Default is Public.
Indicates to use a service principal account, as opposed to a user account.
Tenant name or tenant ID containing the service principal account. If not specified, the 'COMMON' tenant is used.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Logs in using user authentication against the Public cloud, a prompt will display to collect credentials.
Logs in using user authentication against the China cloud, a prompt will display to collect credentials.
Logs in using a service principal against the Public cloud, a prompt will display from Get-Credential to enter your username (your AAD client ID) and password (your application secret key).

Logs in using a service principal with an installed certificate to the Public cloud. The certificate must be installed in either CurrentUser or LocalMachine certificate store (LocalMachine requires administrator access) with a private key installed.

maml:description.maml:para: Log out of the Power BI service.
Disconnects from any previous PowerBI Service connections. If there were no connections, the command completes without error.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Disconnects any active PowerBI service connections.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the access token for your current Power BI authenticated session.
Returns the Power BI access token gathered from logged in Power BI profile. Before you run this command, make sure you log in using Connect-PowerBIServiceAccount.

maml:Description.maml:para: Indicates to return the access token as a string instead of a hashtable. The string contains the authentication type, such as "Bearer".
Indicates to return the access token as a string instead of a hashtable. The string contains the authentication type, such as "Bearer".

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $headers = Get-PowerBIAccessToken PS C:\> Invoke-RestMethod -Headers $headers -Uri 'https://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/groups'

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the Power BI access token as a hashtable and passes it to Invoke-RestMethod, as part of the header, to authenticate.

maml:description.maml:para: Executes a REST call to the Power BI service, with the specified URL and body.

Invokes a REST request against the Power BI service using the profile you're logged in with. The REST verb can be specified using the -Method parameter. The -Body parameter is required for the verbs POST, PUT, and PATCH. Before you run this command, make sure you log in using Connect-PowerBIServiceAccount.

maml:Description.maml:para: Body of the request, also known as content . This is optional unless the request method is POST, PUT, or PATCH.
Content type to specify inside the header for the request. Default is 'application/json'.
Optional headers to include with the request.
Type of HTTP request method\verb to make with the call.
Organization name or tenant GUID to include in the URL. Default is 'myorg'.
Output file for writing the response content to. File path specified must not exist.
Specifies how long the request can be pending before it times out. Enter a value in seconds. Entering a value of 0 specifies an indefinite time-out.
Relative or absolute URL of the Power BI entity you want to access. For example, if you want to access https://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/groups, then specify 'groups', or pass in the entire URL.
Version of the API to include in the URL. Default is 'v1.0'. Ignored if -Url is an absolute URL.
Body of the request, also known as content . This is optional unless the request method is POST, PUT, or PATCH.
Content type to specify inside the header for the request. Default is 'application/json'.
Optional headers to include with the request.
Type of HTTP request method\verb to make with the call.
Organization name or tenant GUID to include in the URL. Default is 'myorg'.
Output file for writing the response content to. File path specified must not exist.
Specifies how long the request can be pending before it times out. Enter a value in seconds. Entering a value of 0 specifies an indefinite time-out.
Relative or absolute URL of the Power BI entity you want to access. For example, if you want to access https://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/groups, then specify 'groups', or pass in the entire URL.
Version of the API to include in the URL. Default is 'v1.0'. Ignored if -Url is an absolute URL.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Invokes the URL https://api.powerbi.com/v1.0/myorg/groups with the GET method\verb.

maml:description.maml:para: Shows detailed error information produced from MicrosoftPowerBIMgmt.* cmdlets.
Outputs additional information for any errors produced from MicrosoftPowerBIMgmt.* cmdlets.

maml:Description.maml:para: List of errors to display. For example, $Error[0..2] will show the last three errors.
Indicates to show the last error occurring in the PowerShell session.
List of errors to display. For example, $Error[0..2] will show the last three errors.
Indicates to show the last error occurring in the PowerShell session.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Displays all errors occurring in the PowerShell session.
Displays the last error occurring in the PowerShell session.
